Warranty and Maintenance Coverage

What is Warranty and Maintenance Coverage?

Warranty and maintenance coverage is a service agreement that comes with your printer or copier rental or lease. It ensures that any hardware defects, performance issues, or technical malfunctions are promptly resolved—either through repair, part replacement, or unit replacement.

This coverage protects you from the high cost of unexpected repairs and ensures you get regular servicing for optimal performance.

Why is Warranty and Maintenance Coverage Essential?

Let’s explore why this coverage is more than just a nice-to-have:

1. Reduces Unexpected Costs

Without warranty and maintenance coverage, any breakdown or part failure can cost thousands of pesos in repairs. A strong coverage plan shifts that financial risk from your business to the provider.

2. Ensures Operational Continuity

If your printer stops working during critical operations—such as billing, document processing, or client presentations—your business suffers. With prompt maintenance and on-call repairs included in your coverage, downtime is minimized.

3. Prolongs Equipment Life

Regular maintenance (e.g., cleaning, part calibration, updates) extends the lifespan of your equipment. Covered printers tend to stay in top condition longer than those left unmaintained.

4. Provides Peace of Mind

You can focus on running your business knowing that your printing and copying equipment is supported by a dependable technical team.

What’s Included in Typical Warranty and Maintenance Coverage?

Though coverage may vary from provider to provider, a comprehensive agreement generally includes:

  • On-site Repairs – Certified technicians visit your location for troubleshooting and repairs.

  • Parts Replacement – Any worn-out or malfunctioning parts are replaced at no extra cost.

  • Preventive Maintenance – Scheduled checkups and cleaning help detect problems early.

  • Loaner Devices – Temporary replacement units may be provided during major repairs.

  • 24/7 Support Access – Some plans offer around-the-clock help desks or technical assistance.

Make sure your provider outlines every service in the contract clearly.

Common Exclusions in Warranty and Maintenance Agreements

While coverage can be extensive, there are common exclusions to watch out for:

  • Damage Due to Misuse – Physical damage from mishandling may not be covered.

  • Consumables – Ink, toner, and paper are often excluded unless part of a managed print service.

  • Third-party Modifications – Alterations made by unauthorized personnel can void your warranty.

  • Acts of Nature – Flooding, fire, or electrical surges may not be covered unless you have specific insurance.

Tip: Always ask for a list of exclusions and read the fine print.

Key Questions to Ask Before Signing

Before entering a rental or lease agreement, ask your provider:

  1. What does the warranty specifically cover?

  2. Is preventive maintenance included, or is it an add-on?

  3. How often will maintenance visits be scheduled?

  4. What is the response time for service calls?

  5. Are there limitations on how many service requests can be made?

  6. Is there a hotline or portal for urgent technical concerns?

The answers to these questions help you evaluate if the provider is truly invested in your satisfaction and productivity.

Warranty vs. Maintenance: Are They the Same?

Though related, warranty and maintenance are two distinct components:

AspectWarrantyMaintenance
PurposeCovers manufacturing defects and major failuresKeeps equipment running smoothly via regular servicing
DurationFixed period (e.g., 1 year or lease duration)Ongoing for as long as the agreement is active
TriggerTriggered by a malfunction or breakdownScheduled proactively, even if there’s no issue
CostIncluded in rental or lease feeMay be bundled or offered as an add-on

A quality rental provider will offer both as part of a comprehensive package.
